comment: All these people are complaining, you just have to put the work in. You also have to turn everything in on time and come prepared to class at the end of each week for group discussions on the readings. The only pain in his class were the midterm and final, but he gives you the possible prompts in class and a week to prepare. Just go to class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment:
What to expect: 
- notes are based on ppt, attendance is mandatory (2 are dropped), weekly readings (either on d2l/textbook) 
- two map quizzes (easy), three discussion papers (one is dropped), weekly quizzes (every Wednesday's class/two dropped), a midterm, and a final

Overall Professor McCray isn't bad, just do your work and you can get an A!

What to expect 
- notes are based on ppt 
- weekly quizzes after every Wednesday's class (two are dropped)
- three discussion papers (the third paper could possibly be dropped/graded fairly) 
- discussions every Friday (based on readings/ppt/able to work in groups) 
- attendance is mandatory (two are dropped)

Overall Professor McCray isn't bad.

I enjoyed the class up the midterm. After the midterm, history was boring again. Not really his fault, but here are some strange things that were:
1. Quizzes that have a 12 hour time window that only open after class
2. Essays in class that you can only bring a notecard of quotes to support (3x5 only)

If not for those two quirks: easy 5.

He is heavy in lecturing and slideshows We had Paper essays instead of tests, but we go over all the prompts in class together so you have some idea of what to write about. No tests, only weekly quizzes, final, midterm, final(3x5 notecard on final and midterm), and 3 papers (500 words). Just show up to class and you'll get an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. McCray uses PowerPoints A LOT. Weekly quizzes and the only tests are 3-4 papers that answer 4-5 questions. (Minimum was 500 words) It's super easy, I guess he read reviews because he wasn't a bad grader. He does a Tophat or sign in sheet or attendance so you have to go to class. Lots of reading which I never did and I was fine. Just show up.

The midterm and final are really hard, including geography, vocabulary and an essay, and its a significant part of your grade. The only other grades are attendance and 5 essays. The essays are graded pretty fairly. Tests are in person. He is death by powerpoint. He is not an awful teacher like some are framing him, the assignments are tough though.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He was a good teacher and very knowledgeable. His lectures were boringly long. He teaches off PPT. Had to write 5 essays, which he graded harder than my English professors. Also had a midterm and final which included an essay each. Wasnt my favorite class due to the tough grading and long lectures but I could tolerate it again if I had to.

He grades very harsh, and 0 feedback. The midterm is insanely hard, and the people rating this professor agree. You MUST show up because he grades attendance everyday. The worst part are HIS. LECTURES. He does not post his powerpoint slides on D2L which forces you to come to class, and also, HIS SLIDES TELL YOU NOTHING. Incredibly hard AND boring.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. McCray really wasnt all that bad. Pretty much all of his classes contained a lecture. You have 15 weeks to write 5 papers on readings from the textbook or the passages he provides online. He takes attendance by either you signing your name, a pop quiz, or a group assignment. No quizzes or tests, just attendance, midterm, papers and your final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. McCray is a fine teacher. Attendance is mandatory, and his teaching style is "Death by PowerPoint", but he is easy to follow along with. The only difficult thing is the Midterm, of which you have to, as most do to pass, study for. Otherwise, he explains everything you need to know in class. He gives 15 weeks to write 5 passages of 500 words.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very lecture heavy and you have to attend class if you want an A. The upside is that you are told exactly what is expected of you and if you put in the work, can get an easy A.

This class was so hard. I couldn't take in all the stuff he lectured about. It was so long and boring. He is a nice teacher but the class was very difficult and I had to drop it after failing the midterm. You have to write at least 5 essays during the semester that are 500 words and I failed almost all of them. If your good at history than take it.

His grading techniques are frustrating, the only feedback I got on my papers was "why?" stamped ALL over my paper and BOOM there goes 10 pts. The hour spent in this class is just comprises of a mediocre power point, sometimes followed by a pop quiz about the required readings, get a question wrong and he counts you as absent. BEWARE OF MIDTERM
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: After reading these reviews, I think he gets a bad rep. A very nice guy, but his teaching tactics may be a little harder than your usual history class. I wish he put more time into the PowerPoints to make them easier to follow. His lectures had me sleeping sometimes, and he is a very hard grader. But BE PREPARED FOR THE MIDTERM.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: MUST READ THE TEXTBOOK BEFORE COMING TO CLASS. His lectures are very boring and his notes are very broad. He grades heavily. Miss one detail and you already get a 50. For the Midterm, you are given 3+ prompts, and you must choose one at random. You need to know all of them to the tee if you want to do well. I do NOT recommend taking his class.

He is not a great history professor. His notes are not helpful, bullet points w/ no context. He speaks fast so listen carefully. Lectures are pretty heavy, he likes to cram in everything. Theres a pop quiz, a midterm, and final. 5 Primary Source AnalysisHE GRADES HARD ON THESE so do your best. Attendance counts. Wouldnt take bc he makes it hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Readings arent awful but occasionally hell give a pop quiz. There is a primary source analysis paper every week but only have to do five total. I was lured into a false sense of complacency. Then comes the MIDTERM. AWFUL. 94 Terms, 28 map terms to memorize. HALF of the grade is a 3-5 PAGE ESSAY. HAVE TO STUDY 3 POSSIBLE PROMPTS. NOT easy class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Participation matters
